subject: Business
title: Single Sourcing vs. Multi-Sourcing
description: A quick, practical guide to Single Sourcing vs. Multi-Sourcing.

hook.text: Your sole supplier's factory floods. Production stops. You have zero alternatives. Revenue drops to zero.

buildup.text: Single sourcing means relying on one supplier for a component. Multi-sourcing spreads risk across several.

discovery.text: Single sourcing gives better prices and stronger relationships. Multi-sourcing provides backup and leverage.

twist.text: After COVID, companies that single-sourced from China scrambled to find alternatives. Diversification became urgent.

climax.text: Apple dual-sources critical chips from TSMC and Samsung to ensure no single failure stops iPhone production.

punchline.text: One supplier is efficient. Two suppliers is insurance.

quiz.question: What is the main risk of single sourcing?
options: One supplier failure can halt your entire production
Single sources always charge higher prices
